meanings.definition: Move or take (someone or something) in a particular direction quickly and suddenly.
meanings.sent1: She quickly whisks the ball away from the dog.
meanings.sent2: The wind whisks the leaves off the ground.
meanings.sent3: The magician whisks the rabbit out of the hat in a blink of an eye.
meanings.sent4: Time whisks us away to new adventures without warning.
meanings.sent5: The tornado whisks everything in its path with great force.

meanings.definition: A kitchen utensil made of loops of wire or plastic, used for beating or whipping food.
meanings.sent1: Mom uses the whisk to mix the eggs for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The chef grabbed the whisk to whip up some cream for the dessert.
meanings.sent3: The whisk danced in the bowl as it blended the ingredients together.
meanings.sent4: The whisk is like a tiny tornado swirling through the batter.
meanings.sent5: The shiny whisk gleamed under the kitchen lights as it stirred the sauce.
